intro: Rhyncholacis guyanensis, commonly known as the Guyana lacis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and produces small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
